page.title: 04OPENCAST MINING AT IBSTOCK
page.content: Between the villages of{Ibstock, {Heather and Ravenstone}lies an open_cast coal mine covering 182 hectares and producing one million tonnes of coal per year. Coal is found 20_30 metres below the surface and is being mined to a depth of 85 metres. Every day, 20,000 tonnes of coal are extracted by mechanical excavators. It is taken by lorry to be crushed and then moved by conveyor belt to the South Leicestershire Colliery at Ellistown. From there the coal goes directly by train to the Trent Valley power stations. It can be at its destination within hours of being mined. The site provides 150 jobs and has reserves until 1990.
